title: Lesson 82
paragraph: This lesson focuses on failure and recovery, emphasizing resilience, adaptability, and perseverance.

words.meaning: having been beaten in a battle or struggle
words.japaneseMeaning: 打ち負かされた、敗北した
words.example: The team felt defeated after the loss.

words.meaning: having a lower estimate of one’s importance; modest
words.japaneseMeaning: 謙虚になった、屈辱を味わった
words.example: He was humbled by the praise he received.

words.japaneseMeaning: 落胆した、意欲を失った
words.example: She felt discouraged after several failed attempts.
He was reflective after the meeting.

words.meaning: able to recover quickly from difficulties
words.japaneseMeaning: 回復力のある、弾力性のある
words.example: The resilient community rebuilt after the disaster.

words.meaning: able to adjust to new conditions
words.japaneseMeaning: 適応力のある、順応できる
words.example: She is highly adaptable to changing circumstances.

words.meaning: restored to a fresh or vigorous state
words.japaneseMeaning: 新たになった、回復した
words.example: After vacation, he felt renewed and energetic.

words.meaning: having gained knowledge, experience, and good judgment
words.example: He was wiser after learning from his mistakes.
Their enduring friendship survived many challenges.

words.meaning: showing persistence in doing something despite difficulty
words.example: Her perseverant attitude led to success.
